definition: fresh produce and freshly prepared foods
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Buy fresh foods instead of frozen.
sentences.chinese: 买生鲜食品，而非冷冻的。

sentences.english: Moreover, a hygienic internal operation will minimize your fresh food loss.
sentences.chinese: 运用清洁的营运理念，降低生鲜食品的损耗率。

sentences.english: Fresh meat, food safety management applications.
sentences.chinese: 生鲜肉品，食品安全管理应用。

sentences.english: Also wash produce, which can carry harmful bacteria.
sentences.chinese: 清洗各种可携带有害细菌的生鲜食物。

sentences.english: C. O. : I'm sorry. No fresh fruits, vegetables, or meats may be brought in.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，生鲜蔬果及肉类都不能带入境。

sentences.english: Fresh food is also more flavorful, so you will feel more satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 生鲜食品也更加美味，会使你觉得更满意。

definition: e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
to put together an order and deliver it (i.e. 配貨|配货[pei4 huo4] and 送貨|送货[song4 huo4])/to deliver (goods)
to retail/to sell individually or in small quantities
market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
supermarket/abbr. for 超級市場|超级市场/CL:家[jia1]
brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
